The growth of population in Japan is phenomenal.
.OUT__
The Japanese population has grown at the rate of 7.3 per
cent during the past five years, and the nation's six major
cities are faced with an increasing influx of people from
the rural areas according to a report just released from
the Statistics Bureau.
Japan now ranks fifth in the world following China, India,
Soviet Russia, and the United States. Japan ranks with
the Netherlands and Belgium as one of the countries with
the highest rate of population density. There are now
five cities in Japan with over 1 million people. Tokyo:
6,900,000; Osaka: 2,500,000; Nagoya, 1,300,000; Kytoi
1,200,000; Yokohama: 1,150,000 and Kobe an even million.
